channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The whole of Mapesbury Road, 5th September
item.description:
The whole ofMapesbury Road has not been swept for several years. General waste and leaves are piling up because of this - This is a health issue and attractingfoxes
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mapesbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blue gooey substance trail from 37 springwater close to end of red lion lane, 5th September
item.description:
A blue, gooey substance has been spilled from 37 Springwater Close all the way to the end of Red Lion Lane. The trail continues along Shooters Hill, with some of it on the pavement and some on the street. cans of the substance have been dumped near the bus stop. The material is sticky, clings to shoes, and is being carried into houses. It appears hazardous and may be dangerous to animals.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Lion Lane, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cul de sac completely covered in fallen pine needles, 5th September
item.description:
Public tree on cul de sac continuously drops needles which covers the entire road and pavement. This used to be regularly cleaned by the council and this is not happening, causing a huge build-up of fallen needles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perth Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree requires pruning or pollarding, 5th September
item.description:
This tree has not been properly maintained and is now causing numerous issues: 1. It is so large it overhangs both our garden and roof (and that of our neighbour), causing damage to our guttering (with fallen leaves leading to blockages and leaks). 2. There is also a safety concern as large branches (sometimes 2-3 meters+ longer) frequently break and fall onto both our property and the road and footpath. On numerous occasions large branches have fallen on to vehicles parked outside our house under the tree. 3. The public path surrounding the tree has been damaged and is increasingly warped as a result of the large roots. This has led to a trip hazard but also to the path becoming difficult to traverse, especially for prams or wheelchairs. This issue has been ongoing and worsening for several years, and the tree now so large as to be causing problems year round - but particularly in autumn or during windy conditions. Please can the tree be properly pruned or pollarded so as to avoid further damage and cost to property or further risk to passers by or vehicles required to be parked underneath. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairfield Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mounds of rubbish and food waste dumped, 5th September
item.description:
The space reserved for the household refuse bin outside 169 Sumner Road has been flytipped to such an extent that there is no longer room for the bin. The area is not only unsightly, but a serious health hazard, as much of what has been dumped is food waste. Please treat this as a matter of urgency.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Commercial Way, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
